raw_text: In evaluations of summarization algorithms, it is common practice to derive the gold standard con tent importance scores from human summaries, as done, for example, in the pyramid method, where the importance of a content element corresponds to the number of reference human summaries that make use of it (Nenkova and Passonneau, 2004) .Selection of the appropriate content plays a crucial role in attaining a high score for the essays we consider here, as suggested by the quotes from the scoring rubric in? 1, as well as by a corpus study by Plakans and Gebril (2013)
